headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Who we are Ivbar is a fast growing and value-driven organisation with the ambition to give more people access to better health to through better use of data. Our advanced analytical plattform, Era Vision, operates on big data to empower healthcare professionals with insights on how to improve the care they deliver to their patients. Era Vision also enables hospitals, governments and insurance companies to benchmark within and between countries, to agree and execute on value based payment models that focus on results rather than activity and alsoensures that financial incentives are aligned with patient needs. Today, we are world leading in this field. We are now expanding from Sweden to several international markets and are looking for a skilled DevOps Engineer that has the ability to identify and address bottlenecks and drive internal development projects to help streamline and support our business growth. Your role As our DevOps Engineer you will work in a diverse role were you designed and manage the development of our underlying tools, our park of virtual and physical machines and the processes that enables us to develop and operate our products, that in the end provides insights to our end users. The tasks range from higher level tech strategies to hands on development. You will work with a focus on automation and play an important role in shaping the DevOps agenda and architecture of our leading analytical platform. You will be responsible for all aspects of the infrastructure, including participating in architecture discussions, testing, analysing and prioritising requirements in an agile environment and also anticipating our future infrastructure needs and researching new DevOps tools and technologies. You will work together with our experienced developers, in a team that shares a complete end-to-end perspective of our systems - covering development, maintenance, operations and IT-security. Your skills and qualifications You have a solid technical background, experience with continuous integration & delivery systems and knowledge of best practice in DevOps environment. You have worked with technologies and methodologies such as - Infrastructure automation with e.g., OpenStack - Overall *nix administration - Containerization potentially orchestration tools for deployment with e.g., Docker - Continuous integration and testing with e.g., Jenkins - Experience and understanding of coding and scripting (we're using Python) You have a Master's degree in Computer Science or similar, or are self-taught with equivalent knowledge. You have a high degree of knowledge of IT-security (e.g. network and application security, threat management, IDS/IPS) and ideally also within the healthcare industry and of managing large amounts of data. You are fluent in English ( working knowledge of Swedish is a plus). You have a track record of finding pragmatic solutions to complex problems with a view on total cost of ownership, and you have a genuine interest in technology. You are self-driven with a can-do attitude, committed and you make things happen. You are also a collaborative team player who thrives working as part of a team to achieve success. Do you want to join our fast-growing team? Ivbar is a true value driven organisation combining brilliant minds from tech, advanced analytics, medicine and business. We believe good health is a human right, and that data analytics is the key to make this possible. We offer an innovative, open and friendly environment. If it engages you to solve complex problems for the greater good, you will have lots of fun with us! We also offer competitive compensations packages.
duration.label: Tills vidare
working_hours_type.label: Heltid
employer.name: Ivbar Institute AB

headline: DevOps
description.text: Sigma Connectivity expanderar och vi söker nu en DevOps att stärka vårt team med. Det är en ny roll som kommer att ingå i utvecklingsavdelningen, vilken idag består av drygt hundra utvecklare och testare. Som DevOps kommer ditt primära fokus att ligga på attdrifta och utveckla vårt interna serverkluster. En viktig del av rollen är också att vara en del avochstötta de agila utvecklingsteamen genom att drifta och underhålla integrationstjänsterna som används genom utvecklingsprocessen. Exempel på arbetsuppgifter: - Planering och exekvering av interna serveranläggningar - Underhåll av både operativsystem och tjänster - Konfigurationshantering - Nätverk (TCP / IP, UDP, DNS, DHCP) - Stöttateam med testautomatisering - Kontinuerlig integration - Integrering av kodanalysverktyg till leveransprocess (ex. Coverity, Fortify) - Säkerhetsanalys av applikationer och nätverk - Informera scrumteamenom förändringar/uppdateringar i systemet - Supporta utvecklare och testare i det dagliga arbetet GRUNDLÄGGANDE KVALIFIKATIONER För att lyckas i denna tror vi att du som söker är driven, ansvarsfulloch har stark kommunikationsförmåga.Vidare ser vi att du har erfarenhet/kunskap inom följande: Linux OS Erfarenhet av CI-verktyg som Jenkins Erfarenhet av versionshantering och granskning av verktyg som Git och Gerrit Goda skriptingkunskaper (bash, Python)

headline: DevOps
description.text: Do you want to work with a market-leading solution, front-line technology and team-up with driven, dedicated and skilled people? inRiver is a highly ambitious, global company with 70 % growth in the software industry. At inRiver, you are guided by our values and work in an entrepreneurial atmosphere. You team up with amazingly talented people where our strong High Five culture provides a collaborative platform supporting our globally growing organization. We invest in your professional growth and with us you develop your skills playing a crucial part in shaping the market for Product Marketing and Product Information Management - right in the center of the global digital transformation. About the job & the team You will be a part of our development team at the headquarter in the central Malmö. You will be the bridge between development and the operation/production in the sense of verification, packaging and deploying the software in the best suitable way for our customers and our different environments. Is this position, you will be a vital part in the chain from the first design to the actual usage. Key Responsibilities - Health checks on iPMC alarms - Configuration and release process - Part of the Architect team building & developing iPMC - Liaison between inner team (Building new features) and iPMC Cloud Ops Requirements We are looking for you who are either a former developer with the core understanding and knowledge of the operational part or you work operational tightly together with the development, or with the understand of what development needs and is all about. - Language; Business level English mandatory - Have experience of DevOps, Continuous Delivery and Automation - Have knowledge within .NET Framework and TFS/VSTS - Have knowledge within JavaScript, Git, Azure or similar - Used to different Agile methodologies It is a benefit if you also have - Preferably have experience of system development in C#/.NET and SQL - Preferably have experience of Cloud services such as Azure or similar - Language: Fluent Swedish As a person you are driven and has a desire to learn with a great technical interest. The person we are looking for takes a great responsibility in their work and has a good ability to solve problems. To be a good candidate for us, it is important that you can cooperate with different persons and also live our core values; Be agile and move fast, simplicity in everything we do, building trust, embrace responsibility and have fun while winning! No one of us is as smart as all of us! We look forward to hearing from you.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Take the chance to be a part of the new established Advanced Analytics Data and Platform team and an exciting journey where we develop the Advanced Analytics platform! Advanced Analytics is one of the three key focus areas for the entire H&M group. We offer you a position where you will contribute within a new established support function. To this team we are now looking for a DevOps Engineer that can manage and further develop the Advanced Analytics platform. As a DevOps Engineer at H&M you will be a part of a fast-paced, buzzing environment where we all share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. The team will work effectively across both H&M business and IT groups and will ensure that the platform continues to be a solution that supports the evolving use-cases from initial proof-of-concept to full production phase. All needs will be delivered in a quick and agile way across diverse teams, to support the try-fail-fast approach. The platform itself needs to evolve over time to support new user cases and adapt to the emergence of innovative technologies. The team will explore Advanced Analytics Proof-of-Concepts as well as run operationalized algorithms. Advanced Analytics provide an important support for our operations and enable fact based decision-making along the retail value-chain. The algorithms we have started to use will contribute to improvements within everything from assortment planning and logistics to sales. We offer you an inspiring and diversified job in an organization that is characterized by that we believe in people and that we work as one team. You will work with many colleagues that have different roles and competences which gives you a broad perspective. We strive for constant improvements and will encourage your personal development. The pace is high and we always challenge each other to think outside the box. To succeed in this position, we believe that you have a pragmatic workstyle and drive towards solution, with a focus on delivering results. You are a formidable team player, dynamic and open-minded with a passion for continuous improvements. H&M is an exciting place for an IT career! We open up at least one new store every weekday somewhere around the globe at the same time as we're expanding online. This requires a lot from our IT-solutions with fun challenges along the way! We offer a dynamic and creative work environment where we as a team grow together. As one of the world's largest fashion retailers we can offer you endless career opportunities. Your responsibilities The job of a DevOps Engineer at H&M comes with a lot of responsibility - and lots of fun. Your to do-list includes: - Handle basic DevOps activities - provisioning, configuration management, and version control - Monitor applications and services, set thresholds and alerting, handle any monitoring alerts in application components - Maintain components including Jenkins, Bitbucket, R Shiny and propose/setup new components - Integration with other I&O teams to ensure end-to-end support of Advanced Analytics operational incidents Just like everyone at H&M, we believe you are a social, open, communicative sales-minded and ambitious team player full of drive and optimism. And your skills include that you: - Have 5+ years' experience in system administration or related field - Have experience maintaining, securing, and monitoring Windows/Linux servers - Can use PowerShell and Python to automate basic tasks - Have experience with Git and Bitbucket/Github - Have experience with Continuous Integration pipelines (e.g. TeamCity, Jenkins) and automated testing - Have experience with (or get excited about) Puppet, Ansible, Airflow, and other modern DevOps frameworks - Have experience with next-gen frameworks like HDFS and Spark The IT department is an important part of the company's business and carries out operations, software development and maintenance of the company's systems and business applications. Our goal is to supply as cost efficient IT solutions as possible in order to offer our customers 'Fashion and quality at the best price in a sustainable way'. The IT-department is located in Stockholm and Borås and conducts business virtually all over the globe. The H&M group includes in addition to H&M the brands H&M Home, COS, & Other Stories, Monki, Weekday, Cheap Monday and ARKET. As an IT-department, we work with all brands.
duration.label: Tills vidare
working_hours_type.label: Heltid
employer.name: H&M IT-Avdelning

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Time to Level Up!      Take the chance to move up to the next level. Come to our new department in Stockholm, where we make a place for the superstar consultants in Embedded Software, Cloud Services, IoT & UX.      We are building a 50 consultants strong team, with developers that have a desire over the average. You will be involved in building up a new department with different skills in strategic digitalization within product development.      We seek a number of different roles for the team in order to strengthen our position in the market. The job will primarily be consulting on location with the customers, but there will also be opportunities to take part in exciting and innovative projects run from our office in Stockholm. You will have the chance to work with top technology of today and tomorrow, sustainable and smart solutions.      Your Role: DevOps Engineer  We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to work in our team of smart products focused software developers - ranging from embedded to frontend.    Your Background:    We are open both for you that have many years of experience as a leading authority in your special area and for those of you that have recently started your career and only have a few years' experience.      We also would love to see a relevant academic degree and previous experience developing front-end solutions. We would also like to see if you have worked in such demanding fields such as the automotive, medical, and defense industries-      Your Role Will Include:    Infrastructure design and implementation  Feature design and implementation  Library and service integration  Configuration Management  Continuous Integration.  Continuous Delivery  System reliability and maintenance.  Performance target setting and performance optimization.  Requirements gathering and documentation.  Review the work of other engineers/developer to ensure adherence to design, patterns and coding standards.    It is important that you have good experience from one or several of the following areas:    Unix/Linux system administration  Common scripting languages  Cloud computing technologies  Configuration management tools and principles  Self-testing to minimize and fix issues  Cloud network security and high availability principles  CI/CD principles    Techniques you are familiar with:    Docker   Kubernetes   AWS   Jenkins   Maven     You should be responsible, full of initiative and have the ability to be proactive. As a person, you need to be responsible, positive and open. You are stimulated by problem solving and you like to be creative when finding solutions. If you are an energetic team player that finds it easy to work with new people, and you are hungry for a new challenge, please contact us here at Semcon.      Application:    Full-time with immediate start. Send in your application today! Selection and interviews are ongoing.
duration.label: Tills vidare
working_hours_type.label: Heltid
employer.name: Semcon Sweden AB

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: The Software design department within Sigma Connectivity is expanding and we are looking for a DevOps engineer to join our team. This is a new role that will be part of the development department, which today consists of more than a hundred software engineers including consultants and is divided into agile development teams. As DevOps Engineer, your primary focus will be on running and maintaining our internal server cluster. You will also support the agile development teams by being responsible for running and maintaining the continuous integration services used during development process. Examples of possible tasks: Planning and executing internal server farm infrastructures Maintenance of both OS and services Configuration Management Network (TCP/IP, UDP, DNS, DHCP) Supporting teams in test automation Continuous integration / delivery and pipelines Integrating static code analysis tools to continous delivery process (ex. Coverity, Fortify) Automation and Infrastructure Automation Processes Security analysis in applications and networks Inform the agile teams about changes/updates in the system Support for developers and testers To succeed in this role we think that you as person are self-driven, responsible and have excellent communication skills. Strong insight in Linux OS Experience in CI tools like Jenkins Experience in versioning and reviewing tools like Git and Gerrit Good scripting skills (bash, Python) An IT security mindset Some positive extras Windows server Git branching strategies At Sigma Connectivity, you will have the possibility to work for some of the most demanding connectivity customers available, with highly motivated and skilled co-workers. In addition, you will have access to innovative technology through our close cooperation with platform vendors and 3rd party companies. We are a Design House and Consultant Company combined, where most of our projects are in-house projects, which means your colleagues are around you even though you change assignment. The Sigma Connectivity culture is about sharing experiences and knowledge, always on the forefront of the Internet of Things. Join us and you'll never work alone again.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: GloriousGames Group Glorious Games Group is a multi-product gaming company located in central Stockholm. It has been around for more than 10 years under the name Stardoll and has now evolved into producing multiple additional titles. Innovative, Professional & Quality of Life We believe that the most important thing when going to work is having fun, gaining new experiences and learning new things. We offer a work environment with a friendly atmosphere and great colleagues. Over the years we have learned a lot, but our hunger for knowledge and experience never stops, which is why we can offer a great chance to learn new things and grow as individuals. We believe that working together is crucial for success. Challenges are always something we take on together and overcome. Quality of life is an important aspect of any work environment, so we strive to take care of our co-workers by supplying beneficial services, lunch walks and activities outside of work. DevOps Engineeer We now need to strengthen our operations team with another talented and passionate DevOps Engineer for continued development of Glorious Games' existing infrastructure platform and building new infrastructure for new projects. The work will be performed in small, dynamic and multi-disciplinary teams, hence the work involves a degree of autonomy and great ability to plan your own time. A big appetite for keeping up to date on new technologies and best practices is essential. To be successful in this role you need to be eager, self-reliant and meticulous. You should also enjoy the fast-paced and ever-changing nature of our business. We believe that an outgoing and engaged person is best suited for this role. Responsibilities - Research and development of new tools and hardware into existing infrastructure - Build infrastructure for new products with a focus on high availability, scalability and performance using rapid deployment - Continued development of existing infrastructure and tools - Maintenance and development of network-infrastructure - Maintaining a high level of security in infrastructure - Triage situations by assessing problems, identify source and apply fixes - Support co-workers with technical expertise - Work closely with other functions in the company (Development, QA) Qualifications - At least three years of work experience in Operations/Development - Excellent knowledge of Linux (Preferably Debian) - Excellent knowledge in scripting-languages (Perl, Bash) - Experience with relational databases, memcached, high traffic sites - Experience with Nginx, MySQL & Haproxy - Experience with Network operations - Experience with load-balancing platforms - Knowledge of Network protocols - Strong knowledge of the common server exploits and their solutions - Some experience with Windows server environment is valued - Some experience with PHP (5.4+) is valued - Some experience with in-house technical support - Some experience with mobile development is valued - Good communications skills with people with varying degrees of technical expertise - Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Perforce, Subversion

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: The ideal candidate should be able to work together with the developers, project lead and security team to grow and improve our cloud infrastructure, automate and document changes to it, resolve incidents, and support developers with necessary cloud infrastructure. At Opera Software, we develop superior products and services for our users around the world through state-of-the-art technology, innovation, leadership, and partnerships. Our product portfolio includes web browsers, payment solutions, news aggregation services, data compression, and privacy. Our products enable more than 350 million internet consumers to discover and connect with the content and services that matter most to them, regardless of the device, network, or location. Opera Payments Platform (OPay) enables users to pay for various services through their mobile or web browser. It provides fast, easy, and secure payments and money transfers. Our key markets are emerging economies in Africa, Asia, and South America, where Opera has a traditionally strong presence and user base. Responsibilites * Improve and scale infrastructure in AWS according to the needs of the project * Manage incidents * Cooperate with the security team to ensure that our setup remains secure * Provide technical support for the developers * Integrating and migrating legacy infrastructure to the cloud Requirements * B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience * Self-motivated, structured, quality-driven and able to take initiative * Systems administration experience with Linux * Programming skills in scripting languages (python/js) * Experience with AWS services, such as ELB, ECS, EC2, EBS * Deep understanding of the network stack and traffic routing * Fluency in English, both written and spoken and good communication skills Ideal job requirements * Programming skills in Go * Experience in 'infrastructure-as-a-code' platforms (Terraform, etc) * Solid knowledge of web technologies like HTML, CSS, and Javascript * MongoDB administration experience * Version control systems (GIT) The ideal candidate should be able to work together with the developers, project lead and security team to grow and improve our cloud infrastructure, automate and document changes to it, resolve incidents, and support developers with necessary cloud infrastructure. Opera is one of the original browser vendors with more than 350 million people using our browsers. We have an extremely strong brand and a thriving user base, particularly on mobile platforms in emerging markets across the world. Join an exciting new project aiming to become the leading mobile payment platform in Africa. Our team, based primarily in Gothenburg, Sweden, is built up from experienced engineers from our browser teams as well as mobile payment specialists. www.opera.com

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: DevOps Engineer at Quickspin is a diverse role focused on Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, development and maintenance of build system along with the version control system. You will work in our core development team along with other experienced and talented developers. The team is in charge of our overall development framework, builds and infrastructure, providing a both driving and supporting role to all other teams. The tasks range from higher level tech strategies to hands on development. We are looking for a person that has the ability to identify and address bottlenecks and drive internal development projects to help streamline and support our business growth. As a person you are a team player with strong initiative and self-motivation thriving in a small team environment where the route from idea to implementation is very short. Qualifications and experience ? Passion for automation & a mindset to automate everything. ? Experience with configuration management. ? Experience with continuous integration & delivery systems. ? Experience with automation servers like Jenkins is required (Working knowledge of Jenkins pipeline is a plus) ? Strong background in Linux/Windows administration ? Solid understanding of cloud technologies (experience with AWS is required) ? A working understanding of coding and scripting (python, Groovy, nodejs etc) ? Experience with Docker and maintaing Docker containers. ? Solid understanding of Version Control & build systems. We also value ? Ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies and cloud services. ? Evangelist for getting software engineers to adopt CI & relevant automation Techniques. ? Ability to develop scripts and automation tools that are used to build, integrate, and deploy software releases to various platforms. ? Interest in researching and analysing the application of new software development & configuration management methodologies to our current needs. ? Knowledge of best practices in DevOps In return we offer an excellent benefit package and a challenging and rewarding job in one of the fastest growing and most exciting industries there is. Quickspin is an award winning games developer working with social online video slot machines for the gambling and social gaming audience. We are now looking for a talented backend developer to join our team, on site in Stockholm. You will work in an ambitious, casual and fun atmosphere at an award winning company. We are also proud to say that we have an exceptionally high employee satisfaction index, flexible hours and the opportunity to have your work seen and enjoyed by millions of users, world-wide.

headline: DevOps Lead
description.text: The platform that digitalizes professional education and training Who are we? Learnster is a cloud-based service that can free the educational content locked within the halls of classrooms and seminar halls and make it available to anyone anytime on any device (mobile, tablet or computer). We provide the technology and tools that can help educators with end-to-end service from giving them platforms to help them create quality educational content, till streaming, sharing and administering their trainees/students. We were recently chosen to Sting as a up and coming growth and innovation company. Our customers are all companies that are in the training/ education field, but primarily training providers, consulting companies and companies training their employees. We have our amazingly talented and dedicated software development team in Ukraine. We are looking for our senior DevOps engineer to lead the team from our office at Sup46 in Stockholm and become the potential CTO of Learnster. What are our challenges? We want to scale our sales for Learnster. As we grow, holding the larger vision of creating impact in education along with prioritizing the needs and demands of our customers is a challenge. We're looking for someone who can lead our development to deliver the most simple and efficient cloud-based educational platform that redefines Ed-tech. What would be your day? We'll start the day with discussing the product priorities from the customer side and align our product roadmap and progress. You'll work with our software development team to assign their deliverables and facilitate them to ensure module delivery. You'll be working with code-review, handling bug/tickets raised by our customers and maintain the codebase to ensure the best experience for our users. You have solid software development experience. You have been in a startup environment where you've experienced scaling products. You have strong leadership skills and you own your product to ensure its success. You're not alien to working in Linux servers or code in python or angular and have experience with Rest Frameworks and AWS. We are in a phase where we have paying customers awaiting to use our product and the accelerating demand is exceeding all expectation. The most critical team-member who has the power to bring all these works to reality and scale it to the next level is you. So if you think this is interesting and would love to talk to us, ping us here and lets meet for a coffee right away. Learnster is a cloud-based ed-tech startup founded in 2017 in Stockholm. Our service helps learning providers and companies that educate to succeed digitally. For the first time ever Learnster have collected a number of learning apps for Classroom training and blended learning in combination with bookings, admin and e-commerce in one place and accessible through all devices. Our goal is to extend the power of digitalization to every educational service happening in class rooms or training halls or in a mountain side hut in a countryside. Our vision is to make every educational movement count. Welcome to Learnster. Read more about us in our website or follow us in our FB or LinkedIn.
duration.label: Tills vidare
working_hours_type.label: Heltid
employer.name: Stockholm Innovation & Growth AB

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: DevOps Engineer to CLX Communications DevOps Engineer to CLX Communications CLX Communications is the world's largest mobile transaction network.Our mission is to simplify global cloud communications from our unique position serving both the enterprise and mobile operator sides of the value chain.They recently won 'Company of the year' at the Swedish Mobile Awards 2017.Your work assignments CLX is now looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our Engineering team in Lund.This position is for an individual with solid years of current DevOps technologies experience.The role will be part of our small DevOps team that support our global Engineering and Operations teams in Sweden, UK, USA and Canada.We offer a CPaaS (Communications Platform as a Service) suite that includes web APIs, SDKs for backend, iOS, Android and self-service web for Messaging, Voice, Video and IoT and is used by many global brands to build their real time communication solutions.Our infrastructure strategy is to use a hybrid of collocation data centers and cloud deployments for maximal availability and scalability.Our backend and API platforms are deployed in most continents and the footprint is growing driven by increased business and data protection regulations.We think you have a drive and passionate interest for hands-on automation of our development, staging and production environments of our global platforms.Tasks and Responsibilities .Collaborate with our global engineering teams to design, build, and deploy an automated platform .Automate systems from infrastructure to application deployment using tools like Gitlab, Chef, Puppet, Vagrant, Docker, Ansible, Rundeck .Deploy, manage, and maintain applications and systems deployed to AWS, Bare metal, KVM, and Docker .Develop and run test cases on applications and services as part of deployment process .Design and develop new features based on the design goals and internal user feedback .Pro-actively look for ways to enhance the functionality, reliability, operation of platforms .Pair with other engineers to solve complex problems .Participate in release and iteration planning meetings with teams Your background .At least 2 years of experience within DevOps Engineering .You have a university degree (BS/MS or equivalent) within Computer Science or Software Engineering..Proficient communications skills in written and spoken English are requirements as we work with colleagues, partners and customers on global basis..Strong knowledge in Linux server administration and configuration, with experience in virtualization, containerization, micro-service architectures .Skilled with in Python and/or Perl and shell scripting .Extensive experience with configuration management tools, like Vagrant, Chef, Puppet, Capistrano .Building highly available, distributed architectures in the cloud (AWS) .Source control like Git and package management tools such as rpm, npm, pip .Experience in continuous integration and with tools like Jenkins and Gitlab .Experience in setting up the full integration and deployment system from scratch .Significant experience in IT management and operations .Experience engineering software systems of medium-to-large scope and complexity .Basic knowledge in Swedish is preferable.About CLX Working at CLX requires a hearty mix of hard work, professionalism, honesty, coffee, passion and fun!CLX Communications connects developers and enterprises to people and things, making it easy for them to embed global communications, including voice, sms and data into their apps, business processes and IOT devices.Our world class communications platform-as-a-service (CPaaS) processes more than 1 billion API calls per month and combines programmable API's, cloud computing with our unparalleled Tier 1 Super Network to deliver one of the highest service levels in the industry.CLX Communications (AB) is listed on the Nasdaq in Stockholm.www.clxcommunications.com Contact and Application This recruitment is being conducted in collaboration with Dfind IT.Please apply via our online recruitment system at http://www.dfind.se/it/ You are welcome to submit your application as soon as possible since we contact and interview continuously during the process.We do not accept applications via e-mail, these applications will be disregarded.Your application will be handled confidentially.

headline: DevOps Architect
description.text: Company Introduction Volvo Cars is on an ambitious journey to re-define the customer experience in automotive through digital technology. We're committed to giving Volvo customers an entire week of quality time back per year by 2025 through these types of innovations that simplify their lives.  We're looking for team members in this Digital organization who think about technology problems and opportunities in exciting and different ways - creative and critical thinkers who want to change the world with us here at Volvo. This role is within our Consumer Commercial Digital Products (CCDP) team, which is using digital technologies to reinvent the experience of becoming a Volvo customer. There's no reason the experience of buying a car should be painful and difficult - it should be as enjoyable and exciting as actually having a new car. That is our mission. This is a rapidly growing team, and we are looking for outstanding people who will be some of the earliest hires in their function, helping to establish it at Volvo Cars.  Job Description We are looking for an experienced Ops-engineer who will help lead our journey from our existing legacy DevOps environment to a new, modern DevOps implantation with responsibility for architecture, development and operations is within Volvo Cars. The work is situated in our new offices close to Gothenburg City in Gamlestaden. Responsibilities * Help and guideline the build-up of DevOps practices and culture * Build up the in-house Application Operations and Infrastructure Team * Manage the Application Operations and Infrastructure Operations Team * Manages tools supporting infrastructure operation, deployment and monitoring * Decision maker in the selection of infrastructure components Skills * 8+ years' experience cloud automation operations * Hands-on experience working with Azure or AWS * Some experience with unit testing and automated testing tools .     Collaborative, team focus .     Extensive experience working with virtualization, IaaS and PaaS cloud .     Infrastructure provisioning tools (e.g. Octopus, Vagrant, Docker) .     Scripting and programming languages (PowerShell, Bash etc.) .     Ability to work closely with software development teams to release production-ready software on a daily basis .      Pipeline and deployment automation experience and tools (e.g. Jenkins, GoCD, Teamcity) .     Experience administering application servers, web servers, and databases (especially Microsoft IIS, Oracle, MySQL, MongoDB, etc.) .     An eagerness to learn enough about whatever tools or tricks are needed to get the job done

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Schibsted Enterprise Technology is the IT division within Schibsted, with offices in many cities around the world, including in London, Stockholm, Barcelona and Oslo.Our philosophy is to move IT one step forward and provide Schibsted with global, scalable and high available services that empowers our colleagues.In ETech Collaboration team we create and maintain systems to enable all the organization to Collaborate.We provide tools, training and support to ensure everyone can share and communicate with colleagues in different locations.This is really important due to the fact that Schibsted is spread on +30 countries.We run our services in AWS and we apply CI/CD mechanisms.We strongly believe in continuous improvement of always-on systems so we relentlessly work to achieve near complete resiliency of everything we do.This means no actual user downtime and seamless infrastructure and service upgrades as well as being proactive to issues.So come join our DevOps team to be at the forefront of active systems engineering and development!Responsibilities: - As part of the technology area within the ETech group you will advise this group as to which technology stacks / cloud / big data solutions to use - Automating the operations and production of large-scale distributed systems so no manual intervention is needed eventually - Help develop a state of the art platform as a service solution using the latest and greatest technologies and approaches (e.g.Mesos, Docker, Microservices, etc) - Help develop the best possible continuous delivery pipelines supporting features like automated promotion to production, automated canary releasing or blue green deployments - Work closely with the engineering organisation making sure that they follow the infrastructure guidelines that you set, and help them make design / reliability trade offs and implement systems that fail over gracefully and transparently to clients - Implement monitoring and logging solutions that enables the production systems to be monitored 24/7 - Respond to requests from engineering by building self-service solutions.Make sure that any tech solution that you put in place is robust, will scale, and failover / BCP systems are in place - Install, configure, fine-tune, and optimise technology solutions Requirements: - A BSc (or equivalent) degree in computer science - AWS expertise - Strong analytical / problem solving skills - Strong *nix background - The ability to write scripts for automation (Perl, Python or similar) - Proven ability and experience developing applications (Golang, Java, Python, Ruby or similar) - Experience in designing and building systems that scale - Experience with modern continuous deployment tools like Jenkins, Git, Puppet, Chef Schibsted Media Group is an international media group with +7000 employees in +30 countries.From Norway to Malaysia, from Brazil to Sweden - millions of people around the world interact with Schibsted's popular digital services every day.In Scandinavia, our media houses such as VG, Aftenposten, Bergens Tidende, Aftonbladet and Svenska Dagbladet keep people informed and updated on important issues in society.Our digital marketplaces such as Finn.no, Blocket.se and Leboncoin.fr help people buy and sell new and old things.In addition, our growth companies such as Shpock, Let's Deal and Compricer provide our users with popular, digital consumer services that make their everyday life a bit easier.Together, this fulfills Schibsted Media Group's mission of?'Empowering people in their daily life'.Learn more atwww.schibsted.com.

headline: OpenStack DevOps
description.text: Missa inte möjligheten att jobba för ett spännande bolag.Med högt i tak, kompetenta kollegor och spännande kunder erbjuds du en tjänst med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter.Devinix jobbar med marknadsledande teknologier inom drift med en svensk molntjänst som de kallar DVXcloud.Devinix hjälper företag inom finans, fastighet, bank mm. att bygga framtidens IT plattformar.Din roll som drifttekniker kommer innebära övervakning, patching och drift av servrar (Windows/Linux).I din roll kommer du arbeta både på Devinix och ute hos kund.      Som OpenStack DevOp kommer du ansvara för att säkerhetsställa driftstabilitet i företagets olika IT-system genom att implementera, underhålla samt testa hård- och mjukvara.Att förbättra tillgänglighet, användarvänlighet och säkerhet för de anställda kommer vara centralt i ditt arbete.Du kommer även ansvara för en del av den löpande hanteringen av inkommande driftärenden.Utöver dina primära arbetsuppgifter ingår det att vara en del av verksamhetsutvecklingen genom att komma med förslag på nya lösningar inom de senaste teknikerna.Du kommer vara del av ett litet team.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: We started iZettle with a single mission; to empower small-business owners to sell smarter by offering them the tools typically reserved for bigger players.We are looking for the best and brightest to help us get it done.Our fast growing start-up was founded in 2010 and currently has approximately 430 employees across its 12 operating countries, with offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, London, Madrid, Mexico City, Sao Paulo, Edinburgh and Stockholm (HQ).      Our tech department is growing quickly along with iZettle, being one of the fastest growing tech companies in Europe, and represents the backbone of the company.      What you will be doing   You will be the crucial bridge between development and operations were you will continue to build and operate our infrastructure environment.This means making sure that our systems run smooth, troubleshooting any problems and solving them permanently.In doing this you'll work closely with our tech teams and manage the operation and infrastructure requests.Security is crucial in your daily work, since we handle financial data and have to comply to PCI-DSS rules and regulations.Furthermore, with your knowledge, you'll play an important part in bringing our operations team to the next level.   All in all, you'll bea part of a young, agile and modern company that always strives for better and more reliable technical solutions.      Who are we looking for   We are looking for someone with a curious mind, that continuously wants to learn new technologies.You have a great interest for infrastructure and operations.Furthermore, you possess the ability to work independently in afast-paced organization.As an easy going and driven person you'll be joining a small team of committed colleagues who're working to change and democratize the payment world.      We expect you to have      - Linux experience   - Relevant education and degree.   - Programming, backend (Scripting languages/object oriented)   - Automation skills and experience      Knowledge that is good to have but not a requirement      - Understanding of distributed systems   - Amazon experience   - Nosql database (ex Cassandra) skills   - Web application firewall knowledge   - Experience working with PCI-DSS compliant infrastructures      Sounds exciting?Send us your application right away!      At iZettle, we celebrate and thrive off the individuality of everyone we work with.We value the impact that a diversity of experience, backgrounds, perspectives and ideas can have on our culture and on the products we build.We’re an equal-opportunities employer, dedicated to fostering an environment where people can bring their whole personality to work; and where everyone can benefit from equal access to professional development.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Det där så kallade “molnet” finns hos oss, vill du vara med och se till att det alltid är tillgängligt?      Vi söker nu fler personer som vill jobba enligt DevOps.I vår värld sitter utveckling ihop väldigt hårt med drift.Det går inte att utveckla driftsäkra molntjänster utan att förstå underliggande teknik.Det innebär att utvecklare hos oss inte bara är utvecklare, de är så mycket mer.Man har ett delat ansvar att se till att tjänsterna alltid är tillgängliga.Det innebär att göra vad som krävs för att eliminera nedtid.Det kan innebära allt från ren utveckling/programmering till skriptning som innefattar automatisering av befintliga processer och installationer/deployments, anpassad övervakning, patchning med mera.Vi försöker undvika att göra skillnad på utvecklare och drifttekniker, istället tror vi att dessa två roller ihopbakade skapar bättre team och roligare arbetsdagar.Sedan är det självklart så att man ska jobba primärt med det man är riktigt bra på och det man brinner för.Vi är duktiga på att hitta rätt utmaningar till rätt personer.      Du som person är säkert lite nörd, tycker genuint att teknik är roligt och spännande, och vill jobba med likasinnade samtidigt som du förstår allvaret i att drifta tjänster för hundratusentals användare.      När det gäller kompetens så bör du vara bekväm med programmering.Det mesta utvecklas i Go och Ruby on Rails men även andra språk förekommer.Det är bra om du har erfarenhet av IT-drift rent allmänt men vi förutsätter att du i annat fall vill lära dig och då löser det sig längs vägen.      och jo, vi vet att det per definition inte finns något som heter DevOps Engineer men nu har du ju redan läst annonsen och förhoppningsvis vill du jobba hos oss ändå;)
employment_type.label: VANLIG_ANSTALLNING
salary_type.label: FAST_LON
duration.label: TILLSVIDARE
working_hours_type.label: HELTID
employer.name: Ilait AB

description.text: Det där så kallade “molnet” finns hos oss, vill du vara med och se till att det alltid är tillgängligt?      Vi söker nu fler personer som vill jobba enligt DevOps.I vår värld sitter utveckling ihop väldigt hårt med drift.Det går inte att utveckla driftsäkra molntjänster utan att förstå underliggande teknik.Det innebär att utvecklare hos oss inte bara är utvecklare, de är så mycket mer.Man har ett delat ansvar att se till att tjänsterna alltid är tillgängliga.Det innebär att göra vad som krävs för att eliminera nedtid.Det kan innebära allt från ren utveckling/programmering till skriptning som innefattar automatisering av befintliga processer och installationer/deployments, anpassad övervakning, patchning med mera.Vi försöker undvika att göra skillnad på utvecklare och drifttekniker, istället tror vi att dessa två roller ihopbakade skapar bättre team och roligare arbetsdagar.Sedan är det självklart så att man ska jobba primärt med det man är riktigt bra på och det man brinner för.Vi är duktiga på att hitta rätt utmaningar till rätt personer.      Du som person är säkert lite nörd, tycker genuint att teknik är roligt och spännande, och vill jobba med likasinnade samtidigt som du förstår allvaret i att drifta tjänster för hundratusentals användare.      När det gäller kompetens så bör du vara bekväm med programmering.Det mesta utvecklas i Go och Ruby on Rails men även andra språk förekommer.Det är bra om du harerfarenhet av IT-drift rent allmänt men vi förutsätter att du i annat fall vill lära dig och då löser det sig längs vägen.      och jo, vi vet att det per definition inte finns något som heter DevOps Engineer men nu har du ju redan läst annonsen och förhoppningsvis vill du jobba hos oss ändå;)

headline: Devops Architect
description.text: Loop54 is rapidly becoming a game-changer in the business of e-commerce.This equals a lot of fun, but also a lot of things that need to be built and scaled up, thus we are growing our development team.Do you want to help us build the best product search engine out there?      At Loop54 we develop a search engine that uses cutting edge AI technology to provide truly relevant search results and that learns from user behaviour to continuously do so.We already deliver search to hundreds of e-tailers and we are adding new ones at an ever quickening rate.From the start our customers where mostly Nordic based but we are seeing an increased interest from global customers and are building for a big geographical expansion.For us developers, this means we need to scale up and automate our operations further and this is what we need your help with!      So, what’s it like to work at Loop54?We value high degrees of responsibility and autonomy.We strive to work transparently throughout the organisation and we always have a humble approach to questions or feedback from colleagues.We appreciate teamwork, diversity and equality.And, most importantly, we have fun at work!      We’re a team of 7 skilled developers and right now we are expanding in areas of scalability and operations.You will work as a Devops Architectas part of a team working towards improving our product and our technical infrastructure.We believe that you have solid experience and a keen interest in operational frameworks, pros and cons of different common database designs, tools and best practices for configuration management, monitoring, deployment pipelines, containerisation and orchestration and that you want to work with the team to define and develop our future infrastructure and operational environment.      Requirements      You...      - are comfortable with English as working language   - are comfortable with several programming languages and possibly considers a mix of golang, python and bash to be your tools of preference   - have experience and a keen interest in working with operations, such as for example continuous delivery, automated testing, containerized deployments, cloud services etc   - have experience with and a keen interest in designing and building distributed and scalable systems   - have a relevant academic background or equivalent practical experience   - are eligible to work in Sweden - the position is only available in Stockholm      Beneficial   In addition to the qualifications, we also value if you...      - have a good understanding of data structures and algorithms, and understand how to apply them to design pragmatic solutions      - have experience with technologies like: redis, mongoDB, postgresql, cassandra, docker, kubernetes, rabbitMQor similar

headline: Junior DevOps
description.text: Do you want to work with a market-leading solution, front-line technology and team-up with driven, dedicated and skilled people?      Are you in the beginning of you career, ready to make a step into a highly ambitious, global company with 70 % growth in the software industry?At inRiver, you are guided by our values and work in an entrepreneurial atmosphere.You team up with amazingly talented people where our strong High Five culture provides a collaborative platform supporting our globally growing organization.         We invest in your professional growth and with us you develop your skills playing a crucial part in shaping the market for Product Marketing and Product Information Management – right in the center of the global digital transformation.         About the job & the team         When joining us in a junior position, we prioritize your desire and need to rapidly become part of the team and our mode of operation.To ensure the best possible onboarding you will be supported and guided by a mentor, an excellent opportunity to quickly become an expert at the inRiver PIM.You will be the bridge between development and the operation/production in the sense of verification, packaging and deploying the software in the best suitable way for our customers and our different environments.Is this position, you will be a vital part in the chain from the first design to the actual usage.         Key Responsibilities          Health checks on iPMC alarms          Configuration and release process          Part of the Architect team building & developing iPMC          Liaison between inner team (Building new features) and iPMC Cloud Ops         Requirements          Language; Business level English mandatory          Have some experience of DevOps, Continuous Delivery and Automation          Have knowledge within .NET Framework and TFS/VSTS          Have knowledge within JavaScript, Git, Azure or similar         It is a benefit if you also have          Preferably have experience of system development in C#/.NET and SQL          Preferably have experience of Cloud services such as Azure or similar          Used to different Agile methodologies          Language: Fluent Swedish         As a person you are driven and has a desire to learn with a great technical interest.The person we are looking for takes a great responsibility in their work and has a good ability to solve problems.To be a good candidate for us, it is important that you can cooperate with different persons and also live our core values:          Move fast          Simplicity in everything we do          Build trust          Embrace responsibility          Have fun while winning!          No one of us is as smart as all of us!         We look forward to hearing from you.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Nasdaq (Nasdaq: NDAQ) is a leading provider of trading, clearing, exchange technology, listing, information and public company services across six continents.Through its diverse portfolio of solutions, Nasdaq enables clients to plan, optimize and execute their business vision with confidence, using proven technologies that provide transparency and insight for navigating today's global capital markets.As the creator of the world's first electronic stock market, its technology powers more than 85 marketplaces in 50 countries, and 1 in 10 of the world's securities transactions.Nasdaq is home to approximately 3,800 listed companies with a market value of $10.1 trillion and nearly 18,000 corporate clients.      Nasdaq is now looking for a DevOps engineer to join our team.The position is based in Stockholm, Frihamnen.The organization houses 700 of Nasdaq's IT talent across many departments including engineering, architecture, development and testers.Nasdaq is the world's largest exchange solution company providing top of the line trading and clearing technology with more than 3,500 listed companies.      As a Devops engineer, you will be responsible for working within a team where you will be required to have strong influencing skills, and be able to work collaboratively with your team to infuse change across the organization.The team will be working closely in collaboration with software development, infrastructure, operations, product, and project management teams.      Your role will entail various activities in the DevOps CICD journey, and will include areas such as Test Automation and migration of legacy practices to new enablers/tools.You must have extensive knowledge of Automation Testing.You should also have a proven track record of working on large scale projects, where primary focus is on infusing transformation and innovation into technology to achieve speed to market and quality implementation of products.You will be working with international clients all over the world.      Key responsibilities       * Coding and scripting in order to generate and implement automated testing of trading systems.    * Contributing to frequent, incremental code testing and deployment.    * Working with a wide variety of technologies and tools such as, Code & Commit tools (e.g.Github, Stash, Artifactory, Stash), Build & Config tools (e.g.Docker, Puppet, Chef), Scan & Test tools (e.g.Junit, Cucumber, Tricentis (TOSCA)), Release tools - (e.g.Udeploy), and/or Deployment tools (e.g.Pivotal, Docker)      Education and experience       * Degree or equivalent experience in Technical Communication, Computer Science, Information Design, or related fields.    * 5 years working experience in Project delivery.      Qualifications       * Experience in Java.    * Experience in code & commit tools, scan & test tools and build & configurations tools.    * Excellent technical writing skills.    * Experience working with financial technology is a merit.    * Experience in Model Based Testing Automation (MBTA) is a merit.    * Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal English.      To be a good match for this role you must have experience working hands-on in any/all areas of the CICD process and MBTA.In addition, you should possess a strong drive to achieve result, have an analytical mindset and be able to work efficiently both independently and in cooperation with others.If you enjoy working in a results-driven and high-performing international culture, and thrive in a creative and dynamic environment, this is the role for you.      This is a permanent full time position located in Stockholm.Desired start date is as soon as possible.As the selection and interview process is ongoing, please submit your application as soon as possible.      Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer.We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.

description.text: For our customer in Copenhagen we ar looking forexperienced DevOpsEngineers As a DevOps Engineer, you will quickly get involved in shaping and handling key areas of our delivery and development process. You'll receive honest feedback and challenging work to help you grow and develop. We'll encourage you to take on as much responsibility as you can handle and suggest improvements and maintain key areas as AWS Infrastructure, Disaster recovery, Security, Scalability, Redundancy, Continuous Delivery, etc. Working with the VP of Engineering, you'll be responsible for maintainingthe AWS infrastructure. headline: Java Applikationsutvecklare DevOps
description.text: Human IT är ett konsultbolag som erbjuder IT-konsulttjänster, lösningar och åtaganden till stora och medelstora företag i Norden. Human IT är specialiserade på Applikation, Infrastruktur, Cloud och Business Consulting. Vår verksamhet består totalt av ca 170 medarbetare i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.  Detta kan du förvänta dig som konsult hos oss: Human IT sätter medarbetarna i fokus, vi värdesätter engagemang och att du vill vara en aktiv del av bolagets framgång. Våra konsulter är främst specialiserade inom Open Source och arbetar och agerar enligt DevOps. Their expanding portfolio covers: BSS/OSS, CRM, CEM, Business Intelligence solutions, ALM, embedded programming, mobile and gaming solutions, managed services, as well as custom development, consultancy and resourcing. Seavus portfolio includes over 3,000 customers, among which leading worldwide telecoms and handset manufacturers, organizations from banking and finance industry, consumer electronics, technology, education, government, health, etc.

headline: Lead DevOps Engineer
description.text: Nasdaq (Nasdaq: NDAQ) is a leading provider of trading, clearing, exchange technology, listing, information and public company services across six continents.Through its diverse portfolio of solutions, Nasdaq enables customers to plan, optimize and execute their business vision with confidence, using proven technologies that provide transparency and insight for navigating today's global capital markets.As the creator of the world's first electronic stock market, its technology powers more than 70 marketplaces in 50 countries, and 1 in 10 of the world's securities transactions.Nasdaq is home to more than 3,500 listed companies with a market value of over $9.1 trillion and more than 10,000 corporate clients.      Nasdaq is now looking for a Lead DevOps engineer to join our team.The position is based in Stockholm, Frihamnen.The organization houses 700 of Nasdaq's IT talent across many departments including engineering, architecture, development and testers.Nasdaq is the world's largest exchange solution company providing top of the line trading and clearing technology with more than 3,500 listed companies.      As a Lead Devops engineer, you must have a degree of knowledge in; Project Management and Business Analysis, and have 'hands on' experience in Testing and/or Development.In addition, you will be responsible for working within a team where you will be required to have strong influencing skills, and be able to work collaboratively with your team to infuse change across the organization.The team will be working closely in collaboration with software development, infrastructure, operations, product, and project management teams.      Your role will entail various activities in the DevOps CICD journey, and will include areas such as Test Automation and migration of legacy practices to new enablers/tools.You must have extensive knowledge of Devops.You should also have a proven track record of working on large scale projects, where primary focus is on infusing transformation and innovation into technology to achieve speed to market and quality implementation of products.You will be working with international clients all over the world.            Key responsibilities       * Ensure existing book of work runs optimally, during transformation to Devops.    * Strategies with management a Transition and transformation plan to achieve Devops.    * Working with a wide variety of open source technologies and tools including GitHub, Stash, etc.      Education and experience       * Degree or equivalent experience in Technical Communication, Computer Science, Information Design, or related fields.    * 8 years working experience in a project delivery.      Qualifications       * Management or leader experience skills essential    * Experience in Java.    * Experience in code & commit tools, scan & test tools and build & configurations tools.    * Excellent technical writing skills.    * Experience working with financial technology is a merit.    * Experience from Model Based Testing Automation (MBTA) is a merit.    * Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal English.      To be a good match for this role you must have experience working hands-on in any/all areas of the CICD process and MBTA.In addition, you should possess a strong drive to achieve result, have an analytical mindset and be able to work efficiently both independently and in cooperation with others.If you enjoy working in a results-driven and high-performing international culture, and thrive in a creative and dynamic environment, this is the role for you.      This is a permanent full time position located in Stockholm.Desired start date is as soon as possible.As the selection and interview process is ongoing, please submit your application as soon as possible.
employment_type.label: VANLIG_ANSTALLNING
salary_type.label: FAST_LON
duration.label: TILLSVIDARE
working_hours_type.label: HELTID
employer.name: Nasdaq Stockholm AB

headline: DevOps at Scania
description.text: Introduction   Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions.IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.   Globalisation, digitalisation and mobility are examples of trends that are affecting our business environment.We are increasing our ability to make use of our information assets and utilize new technology.New possibilities enable us to share data with each other, apply machine learning and artificial intelligence.      The work environment at Scania’s IT department is international and our employees are representing many different nationalities and countries.To this exciting and dynamic environment we are now looking for new IT-professionals.         Your responsibility   At Scania?we strongly believe in teams and agile methodologies, thus you will be working in a team of multi-skilled people.We can offer a stimulating environment where we together always strive to build the best solutions.   Together with the team building up a highly automated deployment pipeline for the area you will work in.      Your profile   We are looking for applicants with an MSc in Information Technology or similar.Work life experience of 3-5 years is required, as minimum, depending on the position.      We think you have the following skills / experience      	Cloud infrastructure in AWS.   	Infrastructure as code   	Automated deployment pipelines   	Monitoring   	Security and infrastructure experience.   	Load balancing / Scalability / Clustering   	You enjoy working in an agile team and you really understand the meaning of the Agile Manifesto      As a developer/engineer you are interested in exploring new technologies and also open to pick up tasks outside of your primary area of expertise.You should have a positive attitude and be able to cooperate with the team, but also work independently when required.Your ability to take responsibility for the application, be structured in your work and focus on quality is very important.You must be proficient in written and spoken English language skills.      The location   Scania headquarter is located less than 40 km south of Stockholm city.It is easily accessible by regional train, commuter train, bus or car.Scania's own bus line, Scania Job Express, goes from Stockholm city directly to Scania in Sodertalje.      We offer   In addition to exciting career and personnel development opportunities, we offer Scania employees a competitive salary and other benefits, such as a company car, performance bonuses, a pension plan, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices and much more.      We can also offer support for the relocation to Sweden and an apartment in Sodertalje.      For more information         Application   Your application should include cover letter, CV and copies of certificates.      About Scania and IT organisation   Scania is a part of Volkswagen Truck & Bus GmbH and one of the world´s leading manufacturers of trucks and buses for heavy transport applications.Scania is also leading provider of industrial and marine engines.Service-related products account for a growing proportion of the company´s operations, assuring Scania customers of cost-effective transport solutions and maximum uptime.Scania also offers financial services.      Scania’s IT organisation is an integrated part of the company providing products and services to all business units worldwide.Based on deep Scania business knowledge and internal relations we balance in-house core competences and service production with services externally sourced and governed by us.We are around 1500 people and the majority is located in Sodertalje.         Please apply through http://www.scania.com/group/en/available-positions/ in order for us to get correct information.   Important!We also need Your full name, address, e-mail and cell phone no in order to register Your application.We will not manage incomplete mail applications.

description.text: Human IT är ett konsultbolag som erbjuder IT-konsulttjänster, lösningar och åtaganden till stora och medelstora företag i Norden.Human IT är specialiserade på Applikation, Infrastruktur, Cloud och Business Consulting.Vår verksamhet består totalt av ca 180 medarbetare i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.Vi söker just nu ytterligare DevOps till vårt team i Malmö.Att jobba hos oss På Human IT sätter vi våra anställda i fokus.Vi vill växa tillsammans och värdesätter engagemang och ambition.För oss är det därför viktigt att du får chansen att vara med och påverka vägen framåt.I utbyte erbjuder vi en chans till kompetens- och karriärsutveckling genom varierande och utmanande uppdrag, tillgång till utbildningar och vårt eget nätverk av kunniga konsulter.Hos oss arbetar allt från nyutexaminerade tekniker till specialister som tillsammans skapar en miljö med högt i tak och utrymme för personlig och teknisk utveckling.Du som söker En relevant utbildning och examen är givetvis en önskvärd grund att stå på, men det viktigaste är din inställning till utveckling, automatisering, integration och delivery.Är du junior i rollen ser vi gärna att du agerar med ett servicetänk och med en pondus hos en senior konsult.Är du en senior konsult ser vi gärna att du inte trampat i samma spår för länge utan att du håller dig ajour med den senaste tekniken.Passar jobbet dig?Förutom detta är givetvis grundkravet att du har några års erfarenhet av diverse Open Source-verktyg kopplat till Continuous Intergration och Delivery.Erfarenhet av LAMP-stacken och skriptning i Perl eller Python är också något som klingar extra fint.Det är även meriterande med djupare kunskap inom: Jenkins, Git, Gerrit, Subversion (eller liknande verktyg) Linux, Apache, MySQL, via mail.Vi intervjuar och anställer fortlöpande under annonseringstiden så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag!

headline: Automated tester within DevOps
description.text: For a customer we are looking for Automated tester. Come and work with the newest technologies within the coolest domain in Gothenburg. Along with new cloud technologies, we are utilizing a scaled agile way of working within a micro services architecture. Continuous Integration/Deployment with a high degree of automated tests within a DevOps culture are essential to us. Domain: Our domain of work is a Cloud environment connected to the cars. Some of the sub-domains are. . AD Approval signals for autonomous vehicles . Situation Alerts to both connected and autonomous vehicles . Traffic Advice . Probe source data processing . Infrastructure to car communication, including the processing of traffic light information . Car to cloud communication to feed off board systems with events within traffic which could increase the risk of accidents . Brake Prediction information to reduce fuel consumption . Geofencing to reduce emissions within urban areas for Plugin Hybrids . Cloud to cloud integrations for a lot of different use cases Requirements: We are looking for someone who is delivery focused, pro-active and able to work under unclear or rapidly changing conditions. The candidate should be technically skilled with both interest and experience of new technologies. If those are in the areas of stream processing and/or micro service architecture, we can also consider candidates with less work experience. A strong, driven, highly communicative person that is not afraid of getting his/her hands dirty is required. The candidate should have a broad competence ranging from hands-on development to the mentioned skills below. Skills solicited: - Stream processing mechanics - Micro service architecture - Experience with some of Spring Boot, Kafka, Docker - Realtime system development - Event-driven and reactive development - Geospatial processing - Information modelling and architecture - Communication networks and Integration Architecture/Patterns - Data mining and analytics - Develop and champion policies, standards and principles - Vehicle telematics domain - Excellent analytical skills - Cloud and virtualization experience - Communication, facilitation and presentation skills - Communication networks and Integration Architecture/Patterns - IT security - Agile experience and understanding - Great understanding of the software development life-cycle, software development frameworks, and the integration of security at the different phases of development Castra är ett entreprenörsdrivet företag med korta beslutsvägar och ägs av personalen. Företaget har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Malmö, Linköping och Sundsvall. Castra har idag ett antal direktkunder inom den privata sektorn och ramavtal inom offentlig sektor. Castra är ett konsultföretag som erbjuder erfarna konsulter inom IT, Industri och verksamhetsutveckling. Våra konsulter är experter på att strategiskt planera, leda och genomföra utveckling av IT som stöd för verksamheten. För oss på Castra är du som konsult vår mest värdefulla resurs. Vi tror på att skapa riktigt goda förutsättningar för dig, så att du kan göra ett riktigt bra jobb. Vi tror att du vill ha möjlighet att själv styra över din tid, lön och din utveckling. Vi erbjuder dig bra valmöjligheter och intressanta uppdrag, så att du kan jobba med det du tycker är roligast, på det sätt som passar dig. Du erbjuds möjlighet till delägarskap och blir en nyckelspelare i vår organisation.

working_hours_type.label: Heltid

headline: DevOps Architect to Ascom
description.text: Ascom is a global solutions provider focused on healthcare ICT and mobile workflow solutions.The vision of Ascom is to close digital information gaps allowing for the best possible decisions - anytime and anywhere.Ascom's mission is to provide mission-critical, real-time solutions for highly mobile, ad hoc, and time-sensitive environments.Ascom uses its unique product and solutions portfolio and software architecture capabilities to devise integration and mobilization solutions that provide truly smooth, complete and efficient workflows for healthcare as well as for industry, security and retail sectors.Ascom is headquartered in Baar (Switzerland), has subsidiaries in 15 countries and employs around 1,300 people worldwide.Ascom registered shares (ASCN) are listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange in Zurich.For further information visit www.ascom.com  Are you an experienced DevOps architect or engineer looking for new challenges?Do you know DevOps, Linux, Windows Server, Smartphone apps and have a good insight in Cloud technologies?This is an opportunity for you who would like to work in a global team with exciting products and work tasks.You will be part of a team that is responsible for building the DevOps organization and for validation, test and product quality work within GPL Unite.The job has a wide responsibility with good opportunities for development.ABOUT THE JOB We are looking for a DevOps architect or engineer to GPL Unite R&D Release team.You will participate actively in development projects through the whole lifecycle from requirements to end of life of the products.You will work with people.You will create and develop strategies for implementing a DevOps mindset in the organization.You are skilled and know your infrastructure automation tools and CI.Our products run in different environments like Windows servers, Linux servers for messaging distribution, smartphone apps and desktop applications and you have seen this before.The team is located in Gothenburg, Sweden and Raleigh, North Carolina.The team is responsible for the buildup of the coming DevOps organization.We have daily international contacts and work in close cooperation with other product quality and test organizations within Ascom as well as outside of Ascom.We work in close cooperation with our developer teams.The team is also responsible for validations, product- and system-test and product quality area, where we handle contacts with customer and drive the correction of the faulty software.We work with developer groups in Sweden and USA, As a result of this some national and international travel can be needed.We use many of the business tools and methods in our daily work, Jira, Python, Jenkins, selenium & fitness.RESPONSIBILITIES .Participate in DevOps strategy development and implementation with in Unite Organization..Participate and take an active role in the buildup of the DevOps team..Manage the multi-site development environment (networks, CI, build clusters etc.)for Unite developers located in Gothenburg and Raleigh NC USA..Work with the development department and test department to improve the quality of the products and services delivered from development..Take the lead on implementing and achieving enterprise class IT internally within R&D..Work in close cooperation with Ascom IT department in areas like networks, servers', firewalls and the DMZ..Participate in the takeover of a cloud based demonstration system used worldwide by the ascom sales force..Participate in setting the long term strategy for our multi-tenant cloud demo system..Drive the improvements of the multi-tenant cloud demo system QUALIFICATIONS .Fluent in English and Swedish .Experience with infrastructure automation tools and fluency in web languages .Experience with CI (continuous integration) tools like Jenkins and Team city..Experience deploying code in to runtime environments..Experience in scripting, python and perl..Experience in database management .Familiarity with application programming .net, c#, C and C++..Good knowledge in Cloud technologies and running SaaS .Wide knowledge and experience in different system architectures and technologies .Experience from DevOps .Good at planning your work .Good knowledge in DevOps strategies We are looking for a software architect or engineer that has 5 years' experience in mentioned areas.It is a merit if you know Unite Products, agile work, or have been working directly with customers.You are as a person positive and a very good team player with people skills.You are good at taking initiatives, careful and we appreciate that you stay up to date in the area, and you have a solid feeling for the importance of good quality.CONTACT AND APPLY Rekryteringen sköts av rekryteringsföretaget Your Talent.Your Talent är det engagerade konsultbolaget inom rekrytering och search.Vi arbetar med att
